content:
TITLE: Defining Python Package Requirements
DESCRIPTION: Specifies required Python packages with version constraints. Includes Django 2.x, sorl-thumbnail for image handling, and Pillow for image processing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/celeryproject/blob/master/requirements.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Django>=2.2.0, <3.0
sorl-thumbnail>=12.5.0
Pillow>=5.4.1
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with pip
DESCRIPTION: Installs all required Python packages specified in requirements.txt file using pip package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/celeryproject/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Django Database
DESCRIPTION: Runs Django's syncdb command to set up the database schema and optionally create an admin user.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/celeryproject/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python manage.py syncdb
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Loading Sample Data
DESCRIPTION: Populates the database with sample content from the provided fixture file sampledata.json.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/celeryproject/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
python manage.py loaddata sampledata.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample License Notice for New Libraries in LGPL
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet provides a template for the license notice that developers should include at the beginning of each source file when applying the GNU LGPL to their libraries. It includes placeholders for library name, copyright year, and author information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/celeryproject/blob/master/celeryweb/static/js/tiny_mce/license.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
<one line to give the library's name and a brief idea of what it does.>
Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>

This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public
License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either
version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

This library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU
Lesser General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public
License along with this library; if not, write to the Free Software
Foundation, Inc., 51 Franklin Street, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA  02110-1301  USA
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sample Copyright Disclaimer for Employers in LGPL
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows a template for a copyright disclaimer that employers or institutions can use to waive copyright interest in a library developed by their employees. It includes placeholders for company name, library name, and author information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/celery/celeryproject/blob/master/celeryweb/static/js/tiny_mce/license.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Yoyodyne, Inc., hereby disclaims all copyright interest in the
library `Frob' (a library for tweaking knobs) written by James Random Hacker.

<signature of Ty Coon>, 1 April 1990
Ty Coon, President of Vice
```
